A summary of sample sizes and biological parameters monitored annually is presented in Table 1. Despite a 12-year long dataset, we were limited by gaps in some of our biological measures and environmental variables (Table 1). This prevented the use of a global approach with causal inference, such as path analysis
44 , as well as the use of principal component analysis to reduce the number of environmental covariables
45 . For this reason, we decided to apply a hypothesis-based approach to target specific questions. We therefore built independent regression models for each biological parameter studied, to test the effects of one or two environmental covariates at a time, to avoid overfitting
45 . A summary of the results is presented in Table 2.
